content: easy chunky ice out hat yarn chunky yarn such as cascade baby alpaca or 128 superwash plain version 80 90 100 yards folded brim version 100 110 120 yards needles us size 11 16 circulars and dpns gauge 12 sts and 24 row per 4 inches in garter stitch sizes adult small adult medium adult large to fit 20 22 24 head for plain version co 17 sts leave 20 inch tail for seaming for folded brim version co 26 sts leave 30 inch tail for seaming brim row s1 knit to end working back and forth repeat brim row until relaxed it measures 15 16 5 18 inches bind off but do not cut yarn instead turn work 90 degrees and using your circular needle pick up stitches along the long edge the slipped stitches should make it easy for you to pick up 1 stitch per garter ridge join in the round knit 12 stitches and place bor marker count your stitches and place a second stitch marker after half of your stitches if you have an odd number you can k2tog for the last two stitches to make both halves even knit 3 rounds or until your hat is at least 6 inches tall decrease round 1 *knit 1 ssk to 2 stitches before stitch marker k2tog slip marker repeat from * to end of round decrease round 2 knit one round continue working the decrease round every other row until you have 8 or fewer stitches cut a 12 inch tail and thread through live stitches cut 7 24 strands of yarn and thread them through the top of the hat so both ends stick out and pull until both ends are equal you should now have 15 12 strands of yarn coming out of the top of the hat separate these into three groups of 5 strands each and braid until you have 3 inches remaining tie an overhand knot leaving about 2 inches of yarn ends coming out the bottom trim the yarn to make the ends even use tail from cast on to seam up the back of the hat block if desired
